intro: Nabalus carrii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada redshank, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, bright red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or chaparral habitats. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Nabalus carrii is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its alpine environment and is often found in meadows and along streambanks.
